intro: Ptarmica vulgaris, commonly known as common centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Ptarmica vulgaris is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
